task_metadata.name: SVQKnInSalientTermSegmentation
task_metadata.description: Salient term segmentation task on the Simple Voice Questions (SVQ) dataset for kn_in.

scores.description: Mean Average Precision, a ranking metric that evaluates detection performance based on confidence scores.
Normalized Discounted Cumulative Gain. A metric that evaluates the quality of a sequence by rewarding correct terms found in the correct order.
Word Error Rate (WER) between the predicted and reference sequences. Lower is better.
Temporal Precision: The percentage of predicted segments whose start and end times are both within a specified tolerance (tau) of the reference timestamps.
Content Accuracy: The percentage of predicted segments where the embedding (e.g., a transcribed label) exactly matches the reference, irrespective of its timing.
Overall Accuracy: The percentage of segments where the embedding is correct AND its associated start/end times are within the tolerance (tau). This is the strictest metric.
The raw count of segments matching in both content and time.
The raw count of reference segments with a temporally aligned prediction.
The raw count of reference segments with a content-matched prediction.
The total number of ground-truth segments in the reference.
Overall Accuracy: The percentage of segments where the embedding is correct AND its associated start/end times are within the tolerance (tau). This is the strictest metric.
Temporal Precision: The percentage of predicted segments whose start and end times are both within a specified tolerance (tau) of the reference timestamps.
Content Accuracy: The percentage of predicted segments where the embedding (e.g., a transcribed label) exactly matches the reference, irrespective of its timing.
Normalized Discounted Cumulative Gain. A metric that evaluates the quality of a sequence by rewarding correct terms found in the correct order.
Word Error Rate (WER) between the predicted and reference sequences. Lower is better.
The percentage of examples that have an invalid segmentation result. Lower is better.
The percentage of examples that have no segmentation result. Lower is better.
Mean Average Precision, a ranking metric that evaluates detection performance based on confidence scores.
Mean encoding size in bytes.
Flops used to encode.
